repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Hi!
I've updated command for Ubuntu/Debian - without this lib nvim build failed for Debian testing on my machine.

comment_regular_data.body: Can you show the compilation failure? There shouldn't be anything that neovim needs from libnsl-dev.

> Can you show the compilation failure? There shouldn't be anything that neovim needs from libnsl-dev.

Sure, here it is.

Deleting library:
```bash
-> % _ apt remove libnsl-dev
[sudo] password for vaan:
The following package was automatically installed and is no longer required:
  libtirpc-dev
Use 'sudo apt autoremove' to remove it.

REMOVING:
  libnsl-dev

Summary:
  Upgrading: 0, Installing: 0, Removing: 1, Not Upgrading: 9
  Freed space: 356 kB

Continue? [Y/n]
(Reading database ... 278539 files and directories currently installed.)
Removing libnsl-dev:amd64 (1.3.0-3+b3) ...
```

... and trying to build:
```bash
vaan@vaan [05:43:19 PM] [~/src/neovim/neovim] [master]
-> % make CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release
mkdir -p ".deps"
/usr/bin/cmake -S /home/vaan/src/neovim/neovim//cmake.deps -B ".deps" -G "Ninja"
-- Found GNU Make at /usr/bin/gmake
-- CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release
-- Configuring done (0.1s)
-- Generating done (0.0s)
-- Build files have been written to: /home/vaan/src/neovim/neovim/.deps
mkdir -p build
touch "build/.ran-deps-cmake"
/usr/bin/cmake --build ".deps"
ninja: no work to do.
/usr/bin/cmake --build build
[0/2] Re-checking globbed directories...
[3/7] Linking C executable bin/nvim
FAILED: bin/nvim

src/nvim/CMakeFiles/nvim_bin.dir/__/mpack/object.c.o src/nvim/CMakeFiles/nvim_bin.dir/__/mpack/rpc.c.o src/nvim/CMakeFiles/nvim_bin.dir/__/xdiff/xdiffi.c.o src/nvim/CMakeFiles/nvim_bin.dir/__/xdiff/xemit.c.o src/nvim/CMakeFiles/nvim_bin.dir/__/xdiff/xhistogram.c.o src/nvim/CMakeFiles/nvim_bin.dir/__/xdiff/xpatience.c.o src/nvim/CMakeFiles/nvim_bin.dir/__/xdiff/xprepare.c.o src/nvim/CMakeFiles/nvim_bin.dir/__/xdiff/xutils.c.o -o bin/nvim  /home/vaan/src/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/lib/libluv.a  /home/vaan/src/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/lib/liblpeg.a  /home/vaan/src/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/lib/libtree-sitter.a  /home/vaan/src/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/lib/libunibilium.a  /home/vaan/src/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/lib/libutf8proc.a  /home/vaan/src/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/lib/libluajit-5.1.a  -fstack-protector-strong  -lm  -lutil  /home/vaan/src/neovim/neovim/.deps/usr/lib/libuv.a  -ldl  -lnsl  -lrt && :
/usr/bin/ld: cannot find -lnsl: No such file or directory
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
ninja: build stopped: subcommand failed.
make: *** [Makefile:93: nvim] Error 1
```

I think this code might be incorrect in `cmake/FindLibuv.cmake`:
```cmake
check_library_exists(nsl gethostbyname "nsl.h" HAVE_LIBNSL)
if(HAVE_LIBNSL)
  list(APPEND LIBUV_LIBRARIES nsl)
endif()
```

I'll look into it and come back a bit later.

The problem was with my cache in the `build` folder. 
After deleting this folder, the build completes successfully. 

Thank you for your help!

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: docs: add lib to `apt install` for ubuntu/debian
